what: Convert sparse matrix into dense matrix — as_matrix
title: Convert sparse matrix into dense matrix — as_matrix
text: Convert sparse matrix dense matrix

title: Convert sparse matrix into dense matrix — as_matrix
Convert sparse matrix into dense matrix — as_matrix
text: x matrix. parallel Logical value, default FALSE. Setting parallelize computation setThreadOptions. sparse Logical value, default FALSE, whether output sparse matrix.

title: Convert sparse matrix into dense matrix — as_matrix
code: sparse_matrix <- simulate_sparse_matrix(   2000,   2000,   density = 0.01 )  system.time(as.matrix(sparse_matrix)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.003   0.003   0.006  system.time(as_matrix(sparse_matrix)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.002   0.004   0.005  system.time(as_matrix(sparse_matrix, parallel = TRUE)) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.002   0.002   0.003   identical(   as.matrix(sparse_matrix),   as_matrix(sparse_matrix) ) #> [1] TRUE  identical(   as.matrix(sparse_matrix),   as_matrix(sparse_matrix, parallel = TRUE) ) #> [1] TRUE  identical(   sparse_matrix,   as_matrix(as.matrix(sparse_matrix), sparse = TRUE) ) #> [1] TRUE

title: Print diagnostic message — log_message
text: Integrate message printing function cli package, message function. message suppressed suppressMessages.

title: Print diagnostic message — log_message
code: log_message(   ...,   verbose = TRUE,   message_type = c("info", "success", "warning", "error"),   cli_model = TRUE,   timestamp = TRUE,   level = 1,   level_symbol = "  " )

title: Print diagnostic message — log_message
text: ... Text print. verbose Logical value, default TRUE. Whether print message. message_type Type message, default info. choose one info, success, warning, error. cli_model Logical value, default TRUE. Whether use cli package print message. timestamp Logical value, default TRUE. Whether show current time message. level Integer value, default 1. level message, affects indentation. Level 1 indentation, higher levels add indentation. level_symbol Character value, default "  " (two spaces). symbol used indentation level.

title: Print diagnostic message — log_message
code: log_message("Hello, ", "world!") #> ℹ [2025-06-02 15:43:37] Hello, world! log_message("Hello, world!", timestamp = FALSE) #> ℹ Hello, world! log_message("Hello, ", "world!", message_type = "success") #> ✔ [2025-06-02 15:43:37] Hello, world! log_message("Hello, world!", message_type = "warning") #> ! [2025-06-02 15:43:37] Hello, world! suppressMessages(log_message("Hello, ", "world!")) log_message("Hello, world!", verbose = FALSE) log_message("Hello, world!", level = 2) #> ℹ   [2025-06-02 15:43:37] Hello, world! log_message("Hello, world!", level = 3, level_symbol = "->") #> ℹ ->->[2025-06-02 15:43:37] Hello, world!

what: Generate a simulated sparse matrix — simulate_sparse_matrix
title: Generate a simulated sparse matrix — simulate_sparse_matrix
text: Generate simulated sparse matrix

title: Generate a simulated sparse matrix — simulate_sparse_matrix
code: simulate_sparse_matrix(   nrow,   ncol,   density = 0.1,   distribution_fun = function(n) stats::rpois(n, lambda = 0.5) + 1,   seed = 1 )

title: Generate a simulated sparse matrix — simulate_sparse_matrix
text: nrow Number rows (genes) matrix. ncol Number columns (cells) matrix. density Density non-zero elements (default: 0.1, representing 90 sparsity). distribution_fun Function generate non-zero values. seed Random seed reproducibility.

title: Generate a simulated sparse matrix — simulate_sparse_matrix
text: sparse matrix class "dgCMatrix"

title: Generate a simulated sparse matrix — simulate_sparse_matrix

what: Safe correlation function which returns a sparse matrix without missing values — sparse_cor
title: Safe correlation function which returns a sparse matrix without missing values — sparse_cor
text: Safe correlation function returns sparse matrix without missing values

title: Safe correlation function which returns a sparse matrix without missing values — sparse_cor
code: sparse_cor(   x,   y = NULL,   method = "pearson",   allow_neg = TRUE,   remove_na = TRUE,   remove_inf = TRUE,   ... )

title: Safe correlation function which returns a sparse matrix without missing values — sparse_cor
text: x Sparse matrix character vector. y Sparse matrix character vector. method Method use calculating correlation coefficient. allow_neg Logical. Whether allow negative values set 0. remove_na Logical. Whether replace NA values 0. remove_inf Logical. Whether replace infinite values 1. ... arguments passed cor function.

title: Safe correlation function which returns a sparse matrix without missing values — sparse_cor
text: correlation matrix.

title: Safe correlation function which returns a sparse matrix without missing values — sparse_cor
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ m1 <- simulate_sparse_matrix(   2000, 2000,   density = 0.01 ) m2 <- simulate_sparse_matrix(   2000, 1000,   density = 0.05 )  all.equal(   as_matrix(sparse_cor(m1)),   as_matrix(cor(as_matrix(m1))) ) all.equal(   as_matrix(sparse_cor(m1, m2)),   as_matrix(cor(as_matrix(m1), as_matrix(m2))) )  system.time(   sparse_cor(m1) ) system.time(   cor(as_matrix(m1)) ) system.time(   sparse_cor(m1, m2) ) system.time(   cor(as_matrix(m1), as_matrix(m2)) )  m1[sample(1:500, 10)] <- NA m2[sample(1:500, 10)] <- NA  sparse_cor(m1, m2)[1:5, 1:5] } # }
